alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 27 at 9:12PM CDT until May 27 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Southern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... Northeastern El Paso County in western Texas... * Until 1015 PM MDT. * At 810 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was 8 miles west of Santa Teresa, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Dust may reduce visibility to less than three miles with winds around 25 to 30 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 128 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 46. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 9. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 162. Highway 54 in New Mexico near mile marker 1. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Chaparral, Clint, Horizon City, Santa Teresa, Vado, Las Cruces, Anthony, Sunland Park, Afton, Anthony Gap, NMSU Main Campus, Canutillo, San Elizario and Berino. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
